channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A federal jury finds Milwaukee judge guilty of obstructing immigration agents
item.description: A jury returns a guilty/not guilty verdict in the case of Hannah Dugan. The Milwaukee judge was accused of allowing an undocumented immigrant defender to evade immigration agents
item.content:encoded:
A jury returns a guilty/not guilty verdict in the case of Hannah Dugan.  The Milwaukee judge was accused of allowing an undocumented immigrant defender to evade immigration agents

(Image credit: Adela Tesnow)
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Suspect in Brown University shooting and MIT professor killing found dead
item.description: The suspect in Saturday's Brown University shooting was discovered dead at a storage facility in New Hampshire. The same man is suspected in the fatal shooting of an MIT physics professor on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
The suspect in Saturday's Brown University shooting was discovered dead at a storage facility in New Hampshire. The same man is suspected in the fatal shooting of an MIT physics professor on Monday.

(Image credit: Boston Globe)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: TikTok signs deal to give U.S. operations to Oracle-led investor group
item.description: The agreement aims to resolve a yearslong standoff between the popular social media platform and the U.S. government over national security concerns tied to China's parent company, ByteDance.
item.content:encoded:
The agreement aims to resolve a yearslong standoff between the popular social media platform and the U.S. government over national security concerns tied to China's parent company, ByteDance.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Mangione pre-trial hearing wraps, but judge won't rule on evidence for months
item.description: After three weeks of testimony, a judge will now rule on whether evidence found in Mangione's backpack can be used in his state trial for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
item.content:encoded:
After three weeks of testimony, a judge will now rule on whether evidence found in Mangione's backpack can be used in his state trial for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

(Image credit: Luiz C. Ribeiro)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: What to know about Jared Isaacman, the billionaire private astronaut leading NASA
item.description: Trump withdrew Isaacman's nomination in May, citing the billionaire's donations to Democrats and ties to Elon Musk. He was renominated last month and confirmed by a 67-30 Senate vote on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Trump withdrew Isaacman's nomination in May, citing the billionaire's donations to Democrats and ties to Elon Musk. He was renominated last month and confirmed by a 67-30 Senate vote on Wednesday.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Austrian nuns await word from the Vatican on whether they can stay in their convent
item.description: The three octogenarian nuns broke out of a nursing home to go back to live in their convent, sparking a dispute with their church superior. Both sides have appealed to the Vatican for a resolution.
item.content:encoded:
The three octogenarian nuns broke out of a nursing home to go back to live in their convent, sparking a dispute with their church superior. Both sides have appealed to the Vatican for a resolution.

(Image credit: Esme Nicholson)
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson

item.title: Inflation cools slightly in November as worries about affordability grip Americans
item.description: The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase than for the 12 months ending in September.
item.content:encoded:
The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase than for the 12 months ending in September.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
item.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.
item.content:encoded:
Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

(Image credit: Sarah Ventre)
item.dc:creator: Claire Giangrave

item.title: Could international troops be sent to Gaza? Here's why Trump's plan hinges on it
item.description: President Trump's peace plan for Gaza hinges on international troops in Gaza, but Israel is skeptical and no country has yet agreed to send their soldiers.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's peace plan for Gaza hinges on international troops in Gaza, but Israel is skeptical and no country has yet agreed to send their soldiers.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: RFK Jr. and Dr. Oz announce moves to ban gender-affirming care for young people
item.description: The Trump administration Thursday proposed two rules targeting hospitals that treat transgender children and youth using Medicare and Medicaid as the lever. The move would affect trans youth who have private insurance, too.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration Thursday proposed two rules targeting hospitals that treat transgender children and youth using Medicare and Medicaid as the lever. The move would affect trans youth who have private insurance, too.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin
